questions.question: What type of data are Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) designed to process?
options: Data organized as graphs of nodes and edges
Data organized as grids of pixels
Data organized as sequences of values
Data organized as isolated records

questions.question: Which problems are well suited for Graph Neural Networks?
options: Modeling social networks and molecules
Processing images and videos
Recognizing spoken language streams
Sorting lists of numeric values

questions.question: What is a main advantage of autoencoders?
questions.explanation: Autoencoders compress input data into a lower-dimensional latent space, allowing them to learn efficient internal representations.
options: They can learn compact data representations
They can classify labeled training data
They can generate rule-based predictions
They can compute exact probability values

questions.question: What is the role of the latent space in an autoencoder?
options: It stores compressed versions of the input
It stores raw copies of the input
It stores final class predictions
It stores random noise for training

questions.question: What is special about Architecture of Autoencoders?
options: We train the encoder and decoder together
We train the network in separate stages
We train only the encoder during learning
We train only the decoder during learning

questions.question: What is the main idea behind Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)?
questions.explanation: GANs use a generator and a discriminator trained adversarially: one creates samples, the other judges them.
options: Two networks compete to improve generation
One network predicts fixed output values
One network stores all training examples
Two networks process data independently

questions.question: What is the role of the discriminator in a GAN?
options: It decides if samples look real
It generates new synthetic samples
It compresses images into vectors
It applies filters to input data

questions.question: Which tasks are GANs commonly used for?
questions.explanation: GANs are widely used for generating images, augmenting datasets, and performing style transfer between visual domains.
options: Image creation and style transfer
Classify different classes in the picture
Predicting stock prices directly
Image classification

questions.question: What is the main mechanism that Transformers use to process data?
questions.explanation: Transformers rely on attention to determine which parts of the input are most relevant when computing representations.
options: They use attention to weight information
They use recursion to process sequences
They use convolution to scan images
They use rules to select features

questions.question: Why are Transformers well suited for long sequences?
questions.explanation: Attention allows Transformers to connect distant elements in a sequence without relying on step-by-step recurrence.
options: They model long-range dependencies directly
They process tokens one at a time
They use memory cells for state tracking
They reset context after each layer

questions.question: Which applications commonly use Transformer models?
options: Language processing and vision tasks
Sorting numbers and matrices
Controlling physical robot arms
Solving algebraic equations

questions.question: What type of data are Recurrent Neural Networks best suited for?
questions.explanation: RNNs are designed to process sequences by keeping information from previous inputs through internal memory.
options: They are suited for short sequential data
They are suited for long sequential data
They are suited for image grids
They are suited for static tables

questions.question: What is the main role of the loops in an RNN?
options: They store information from earlier steps
They remove noise from the input
They enlarge the input vectors
They speed up matrix operations

questions.question: What type of data are Convolutional Neural Networks mainly designed for?
options: visual image data
text sequences
graph structures
numeric tables

questions.question: What is the main purpose of convolutional layers in a CNN?
questions.explanation: Convolutional layers detect patterns such as edges, textures, and shapes that are useful for recognizing objects.
options: They extract important visual features
They store long-term memory values
They compare predicted class labels
They generate random image samples

questions.question: Why are pooling layers used in CNNs?
questions.explanation: Pooling reduces the dimensionality of feature maps, which makes the network more efficient and robust.
options: They reduce the spatial data size
They increase the image resolution
They improve class label accuracy
They add noise to the features
